solution_line_template: She has {num_monday_appointments} {duration_monday_appointment} hour appointments on Monday for a total of {num_monday_appointments}*{duration_monday_appointment} = <<{num_monday_appointments}*{duration_monday_appointment}={total_monday_hours}>>{total_monday_hours} hours

She has {num_thursday_appointments} {duration_thursday_appointment} hour appointments on Thursday for a total of {num_thursday_appointments}*{duration_thursday_appointment} = <<{num_thursday_appointments}*{duration_thursday_appointment}={total_thursday_hours}>>{total_thursday_hours} hours

She is working {total_monday_hours} hours on Monday, {tuesday_hours} hours on Tuesday, {total_thursday_hours} hours on Thursday and {saturday_hours} hours on Saturday for a total of {total_monday_hours}+{tuesday_hours}+{total_thursday_hours}+{saturday_hours} = <<{total_monday_hours}+{tuesday_hours}+{total_thursday_hours}+{saturday_hours}={total_weekly_hours}>>{total_weekly_hours} hours

She charges ${hourly_rate} an hour and is working {total_weekly_hours} hours a week for a total of {hourly_rate}*{total_weekly_hours} = $<<{hourly_rate}*{total_weekly_hours}={total_money_made}>>{total_money_made}
